University of Milan: The University of Milan (Italian: Universit√† degli Studi di Milano; Latin: Universitas Studiorum Mediolanensis), officially shortened in UniMi, or colloquially referred to as La Statale (lit. "the state one"), is a public research university in Milan, Italy. It is one of the largest universities in Europe, with about 60,000 students,[5] and a permanent teaching and research staff of about 2,000.[6]
